Submodules

vipcals.pipeline module

vipcals.pipeline.calibrate(filepath_list, filename_list, outpath_list, log_list, target_list, sources, load_all, full_source_list, disk_number, aips_name, klass, multi_id, selfreq, bif, eif, default_refant, default_refant_list, search_central, max_scan_refant_search, time_aver, freq_aver, fringefit_snr, default_solint, min_solint, max_solint, phase_ref, input_calibrator, subarray, shift_coords, load_antab, channel_out, flag_edge, interactive, stats_df)

Main workflow of the pipeline

Parameters:

  • filepath_list (list of str) – list of paths to the original uvfits/idifits files

  • filename_list (list of str) – list containing the names of the subdirectories of each target

  • outpath_list (list of str) – list containing the output file paths for each target

  • log_list (list of file) – list of log files

  • target_list (list of str) – science target names

  • sources (list of str) – all sources to be loaded

  • load_all (bool) – load all sources on the dataset

  • full_source_list (list of Source objects) – list containing all sources in the dataset

  • disk_number (int) – disk number within AIPS

  • aips_name (str) – name for the catalogue entry in AIPS

  • klass (str) – class name within AIPS

  • multi_id (bool) – whether there are multiple frequency ids present

  • selfreq (int) – if there are multiple frequency ids, which one to load

  • bif (int) – first IF to copy, 0 => 1

  • eif (int) – highest IF to copy, 0 => all higher than bif

  • default_refant (str) – force the pipeline to choose this reference antenna by giving its antenna code

  • default_refant_list (list of str) – list of prioritized antenna codes to use as reference antenna

  • search_central (bool) – for VLBA datasets, give priority to KP, LA, PT, OV, FD

  • max_scan_refant_search (int) – maximum number of scans per source where the SNR is computed when looking for reference antenna

  • time_aver (int) – time sampling threshold in seconds for time averaging

  • freq_aver (int) – channel width sampling threshold in kHz for frequency averaging

  • fringefit_snr (float) – S/N threshold for the target fringe fit

  • default_solint (int) – solution interval for the science target fringe fit

  • min_solint (int) – minimum solution interval allowed for the science target fringe fit

  • max_solint (int) – maximum solution interval allowed for the science target fringe fit

  • phase_ref (list of str) – list of phase calibrator names for phase referencing

  • input_calibrator (str) – force the pipeline to use this source as calibrator

  • subarray (bool) – split the dataset in subarrays and choose the one with the science target

  • shift_coords (list of astropy.coordinates.SkyCoord) – list of new coordinates for the targets, as Astropy SkyCoord objects, in case a phase shift was necessary

  • load_antab (str) – path of an external ANTAB file with amplitude calibration information

  • channel_out (str) – ‘SINGLE’ -> export one channel per IF, ‘MULTI’ -> export multiple channels per IF

  • flag_edge (float) – fraction of the total channels to flag at the edge of each IF

  • interactive (bool) – produce interactive plots in the GUI

  • stats_df (pandas.DataFrame object) – Pandas DataFrame where to keep track of the different statistics

vipcals.pipeline.pipeline(input_dict)

Read the inputs, split multiple frequencies and calibrate the dataset

Parameters:

input_dict (_type_) – _description_
